search_information.query_displayed: Sibling Similarities in Educational Attainment: A Comparison of Like-Sex and Cross-Sex Sibling Pairs. Benin, Mary Holland Johnson, David R. Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: Sibling similarities in educational attainment: A comparison of like-sex and cross-sex sibling pairs
organic_results.snippet: Using data on brothers and sisters from two separate sample surveys, the authors test the hypothesis that independent of measured family-status effects, the amount of educational resemblance of siblings differs across the sex combinations of the pairs. The hypothesis is confirmed; older brother-younger brother pairs were found to be the most similar of all sex combinations, while the older sister-younger brother pairs were the least similar. Common heredity, common environment, and inter-sibling effects explanations of this difference in …
